event: the Christmas Rebellion of slaves is brought to an end in Jamaica
Charles Dickens's Oliver Twist begins publication in serial form in London.
El Salvador proclaims itself an independent republic
the first passenger railway wholly within modern-day Denmark opens
the new Palace of Westminster opens in London
A Tale of Two Cities by Charles Dickens is published in England
the current Japanese era name is changed to the Meiji period
New York City annexes The Bronx
the journal Science is first published in the United States
Eastern Rumelia declares its union with Bulgaria
the first train load of oranges leaves Los Angeles via the United States transcontinental railroad
Oscar Wilde is arrested in London
